items.title: The punishment imposed on the son of "Faisal the Great" who ran over Amit to death
items.subtitle: The Haifa District Court also imposed a suspended sentence on him and financial compensation in the amount of 350 thousand shekels. His lawyers are expected to appeal the verdict and the conviction - with emphasis on the conviction for the offense of abandonment in the accident that occurred in 2022. Judge Amir Tobi: "The severity of the offenses is summed up in his conduct since the accident and actually until today"

items.title: Right after they returned home: The first message from Gali and Zivi
items.subtitle: Thousands of residents welcomed David and Ariel Cunio today, who were released from the hospital and will return home after more than two years in Hamas captivity. Meanwhile in Kfar Aza and Beit Guvrin - celebrating the arrival of the brothers Gali and Ziv. Also in Kiryat Malakhi awaiting the return of Yosef Haim Ohana

media.title: Captivity survivors Ziv and Gali Berman in a thank you video after returning home

items.title: The silent liver disease - the organ that functions as the diligent worker in our body
items.subtitle: The liver is responsible for thousands of actions in the body, including breaking down toxins and maintaining body heat. Despite its immense importance, liver cancer is usually discovered only in advanced stages of the disease. What is the connection between the disease and fatty food and alcohol consumption, in which places in the world the disease is common and about the new treatments. Watch

items.title: "Monsters cut off your life": Hundreds at the funeral of Uriel Baruch z"l
items.subtitle: Hundreds came to Har HaMenuchot to accompany Uriel Baruch on his last journey, who was kidnapped from the Nova party and his body was returned to Israel last week after more than two years in captivity in Gaza. His wife Rivka: "We had many more plans, but evil monsters cut off your life". His brother Roi: "I promise you, I will make sure you are remembered forever"

media.title: The funeral of Uriel Baruch, Har HaMenuchot Cemetery in Jerusalem. October 19, 2025

items.title: They returned from hell - but for the government it's still not enough
items.subtitle: Captivity survivors returned after more than two years in tunnels in Gaza where they suffered torture and extreme hunger - but the State of Israel gives them only 50% disability and a monthly allowance of only 3,300 shekels. Despite broad political agreement and National Insurance ready to implement - the Knesset still does not raise the disability percentages to 100%

items.title: It's inconceivable that Netanyahu was not confronted on Channel 14 with his crazy statement
items.subtitle: In "Meet the Press" they still haven't understood that every time they give the stage to Ben Gvir, the stain sticks to them too. On Channel 14 they failed to prevent Netanyahu from stumbling, but above the two politicians stood a heroic woman who conquered not only tens of thousands in the square, but also the hearts of viewers at home

items.title: Coffee after meat: Strauss's CowFree opens new menus
items.subtitle: No longer a "substitute" but another intriguing path: The new CowFree series brings back taste and texture like milk, with Yotvata drink for coffee and foaming and Symphony spread for desserts, baking and spreading. "There is no other product that can give this combination"

items.title: Sanne burning: The man who will save Manchester United at Anfield?

items.title: Fire broke out in the compartment above the passengers. The plane made an emergency landing

items.title: Egged presents a new app, an alternative to Moovit
items.subtitle: After years in which Moovit dominated the market almost alone, the Egged Group is launching "egg" - a new public transportation app that promises an ad-free user experience. It centralizes all travel services in one app, and puts a question mark on the dominant advertising model in the field

items.title: "The Religious Reform": This is how they distance Israel's tradition from the people of Israel
items.subtitle: Those who seek to impose religious symbols on the entire public are doing a very bad service to Judaism and distancing from it those who were willing to approach it with joy, if only they had asked them nicely

items.title: Nova party survivors criticize: "Dealing with proving disability"
items.subtitle: Omer Leshem, Nova survivor, said in a Knesset discussion dealing with the medical recognition process: "We need everyone's help". Representative of the Nova tribe community said: "Roi had all the risk factors". Meshi Sandrovich, from the Rehabilitation Division at National Insurance, noted: "Waiting times are not long"

items.title: Winter time 2025 in Israel: When do we move the clock? | The complete guide
items.subtitle: On the night between Saturday and Sunday, at 2:00 a.m. we will be required to move the clock hands one hour back to 1:00. This will indeed lose an additional hour of light - but we will gain an hour of sleep. How to set the clock on the mobile device and when do we return to summer time? | The complete guide

items.title: Kara'i found another reason to change the name of the war: "In Gematria it's like Bibi"
items.subtitle: By a majority of votes, the government today approved to call the campaign a permanent official name, instead of "Iron Swords". Minister Orit Strook opposed and Minister Amichai Chikli abstained. Netanyahu argued: "This is the war of resurrection of our people, as a direct continuation of the War of Independence". Kara'i: "The word 'revival' - in Gematria like Bibi Netanyahu"

media.title: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at a government meeting, the Kirya, Tel Aviv. December 31, 2023

items.title: Smotrich tweeted: "War!"; Families of the kidnapped casualties: "Irresponsible"
items.subtitle: While the battles are renewed in the south of the Strip and the IDF attacks in Rafah, the families of the kidnapped casualties respond in anger to the collapse of the agreement. According to them, Israel is abandoning those who remained in Gaza and dragging the country back to fighting before the return of all the kidnapped was completed

media.title: Yael Adar, mother of Tamir Hadar, after the meeting with the Prime Minister in the Kirya. 19.12.2023

items.title: Following the incident in Gaza: Netanyahu left the government meeting for a security discussion
items.subtitle: Against the background of anti-tank missile fire towards an IDF force in the Rafah area in the south of the Strip, the National Security Minister said: "False delusions that Hamas will abide by the agreement it signed, prove as expected to be dangerous to our security". According to him, "The Nazi terror organization must be destroyed completely - and better one hour earlier"

media.title: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu with Itamar Ben Gvir the Minister of National Security after approving the return of Otzma Yehudit ministers to the government, March 19, 2025

items.title: You decide: Is it okay to come with such a dress to a wedding?
items.subtitle: Noel just wanted to share a cute video with her partner on the way to the wedding, but her tight maxi dress with the deep cleavage sparked a heated debate. items.title: Didn't fake his death: The true story behind the "funeral" of the living man
items.subtitle: Reports around the world told about a 74-year-old Indian who faked his death to see who would come to the funeral. But the truth, as revealed now, is much more moving: He held a symbolic ceremony to inaugurate a crematorium he built with his money for his village

items.title: End of the world prophecy about "the white brother" with the red hat and the connection to Trump
items.subtitle: An ancient prophecy of the Hopi tribe, presented at the UN in 1992, predicted the coming of a savior with a "red hat" who will change the world. Now, a popular podcast claims that the figure is Donald Trump, and his two aides are Elon Musk and J.D. Vance. Are we at the threshold of "the great upheaval"?

items.title: Watch: Medical negligence is not a story of patient vs doctor - it's a whole system
items.subtitle: Delay in diagnosis, treatment error or poor communication between doctor and patient - not every medical error is negligence, but when damage is caused it can sometimes be sued. Dr. Daniel Shevach, a veteran lawyer in the field, explains why it's a systemic process, how the doctor's conduct is examined in real time, and what every patient should understand before acting.
